title: Chinese and U.S. Officials Reach Framework of a Trade Deal
summary: Negotiators announced on Sunday they have preliminarily agreed on several issues ahead of an expected meeting between President Trump and Xi Jinping this week.

title: The ‘Sleeper Issue’ at the Heart of Trump’s Trade War on China
summary: Concern is increasing throughout Southeast Asia as U.S. officials, intent on slowing China, have yet to say how they will define the origin country of imports.

title: Trump Opens Trip With Trade Deals in Southeast Asia
summary: The U.S. announced agreements on Sunday with Malaysia, Thailand and Cambodia, securing support for its efforts to pressure China on trade and critical minerals.

title: Trump Announces Tariff Increase on Canada Over Reagan Ad Spat
summary: The ad, which will stop airing on Monday, used audio of a 1987 address by Ronald Reagan making a case against tariffs.

title: Police Make Arrests in Louvre Robbery, Authorities Say
summary: Four thieves broke into the famed Paris museum last week and stole over $100 million in historical jewelry, shocking France and the world. It is unclear how many people were arrested.

title: A Break-In That Shook France
summary: The robbery at the Louvre left behind more than broken glass. It battered the pride of a nation that is increasingly glum about itself and its direction.

title: German Company Launches Ad After Its Lift Is Used in Louvre Heist
summary: The brazen daylight robbery of the Louvre has turned into a marketing opportunity for Böcker, a German maker of cranes and elevators whose product was used in the heist.

title: In Trump-Friendly Iowa, the President’s Policies Have Hit Hard
summary: The state has become a stronghold for President Trump. Now, his efforts on trade, energy and immigration are squeezing farmers, disrupting labor and threatening industries.

title: Under Trump, Voice of America Is Down but Not Out
summary: Buttressed by courts and support from some Republican lawmakers, federally funded newsrooms that President Trump has tried to eliminate have yet to be rendered obsolete.

title: As the Left’s Biggest Stars Unite Behind Mamdani, a Bigger Test Awaits
summary: Senator Bernie Sanders and Representative Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez will join Zohran Mamdani on Sunday to help push his bid to win the Nov. 4 election for mayor of New York City.

title: Can Cuomo Sway Trump Voters Away From Sliwa in the NYC Mayor’s Race?
summary: Former Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo, a Democrat running on a third-party line, has appeared repeatedly on Staten Island and shifted his messaging in ways that seem designed to court Republican voters.

title: Vance Criticizes Mamdani’s Comments About Islamophobia After 9/11
summary: Zohran Mamdani said the vice president’s attack on social media was one in a series of “cheap jokes about Islamophobia.”

title: The Thread Tying Together Everything Trump Does
summary: Whether he is negotiating a deal in the Middle East, bombing boats off the coast of Venezuela or deploying troops to American cities, it’s always about power.

title: The Wish to Be Seen
summary: The first time photographer Laylah Amatullah Barrayn saw a portrait of Omar ibn Said, she felt he was speaking to her.

title: 3 Years Ago It Was a Casting Agency. Now It Has $1 Billion in Drone Contracts.
summary: Among the flood of Ukrainian defense start-ups, one stands out to both its supporters and its critics: the drone maker Fire Point.

title: Turkey Offered to Help in Postwar Gaza. Israel Isn’t About to Say Yes.
summary: As a guarantor of the cease-fire, Turkey is keen to play a role in Gaza’s future, seeing political and economic benefits. Israel is having none of it.

title: Pope Leo’s Permission for Latin Mass in St. Peter’s Gives Traditionalists Hope
summary: Pope Francis greatly limited the use of the traditional Latin Mass, believing it sowed division. Traditionalist Catholics are hoping Pope Leo charts a different path.
